q: Nearly three decades later, "the Donald Rumsfeld problem" came to the Pentagon with orders from President Bush to shake the place up. "Change is hard for people," Donald Rumsfeld said. Change is hard. But did you make it harder than it had to be by alienating people? asked Martin. What: Barbara Walters , who had her own surgery to repair a faulty heart valve last year, addresses heart disease and the fear many have of a heart operation in A Matter of Life and Death. She talks to former Bill Clinton , David Letterman , Robin Williams and Regis Philbin , celebrities who've had heart surgeries. She also talks to doctors, including her own, about prevention and the warning signs of heart trouble.

Nokia's Chief Executive Stephen Elop said that Nokia and Microsoft will combine our strengths to deliver an ecosystem with unrivalled global reach and scale. It's now a three-horse race.
